intro: Aeschynomene shirensis, commonly known as Shirensis Aeschynomene, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. This plant is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Aeschynomene shirensis is also valued for its potential in soil improvement due to its nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
